lead_paragraph: The law, which was significantly revised after Gov. Chris Christie vetoed the original, is intended to make it easier for small businesses to offer a tax-deferred savings program to employees.
snippet: The law, which was significantly revised after Gov. Chris Christie vetoed the original, is intended to make it easier for small businesses to offer a tax-deferred savings program to employees.

headline.main: New Jersey Creates Retirement Savings Plan, Modified by Christie
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Establishes Savings Plan Marketplace

abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie signs bill to create New Jersey Small Business Marketplace, which will connect eligible employers and their employees with retirement plan providers that meet specific criteria; bill is revised version of one that passed both houses of New Jersey Legislature, which would have required businesses with over 25 employees to offer state-run retirement program if they did not already provide access to a plan.
